comment._content: Thomas William Hodgson Crosland (1865-1924), author of "The Unspeakable Scot" en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thomas_William_Hodgson_Crosland Related to the 1914 court case with: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/5537492468/in/set-72157603624867509/] T. W. H. Crosland author of "The Unspeakable Scot" and a number of other books, who was charged with being concerned with Lord Alfred Douglas and others to charge falsely with a criminal offense Robert B. Ross, executor of the estate of the late Oscar Wilde, was found not guilty by a jury yesterday. Source: New York Times; July 7, 1914 select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F20613FC355E1273...
